metadata.Title: CVE-2020-14633 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:InnoDB). Supported versions that are affected are 8.0.20 and prior. Easilyexploitable vulnerability allows high privileged attacker with networkaccess via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server. Successfulattacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized update, insert ordelete access to some of MySQL Server accessible data. CVSS 3.1 Base Score2.7 (Integrity impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14633` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.21-0ubuntu3
mysql-client - 8.0.21-0ubuntu3
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.21-0ubuntu3
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.21-0ubuntu3
mysql-router - 8.0.21-0ubuntu3
mysql-server - 8.0.21-0ubuntu3
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.21-0ubuntu3
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.21-0ubuntu3
mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.21-0ubuntu3
mysql-testsuite - 8.0.21-0ubuntu3
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.21-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-8.0 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.21-0ubuntu3').
